column5: hi all,   i'll let the video say it.   <object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JKg6byO7HNc?hl=en&fs=1"></param><param'>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JKg6byO7HNc?hl=en&fs=1"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JKg6byO7HNc?hl=en&fs=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="425" height="344"></embed></object>
Thanks for sharing Simon!!! Enjoy EVERY day !
He's got it all down pat. He'll be showing us all up in no time.
Sweet! I just showed it to my wife; she loved it too!  Smart little fella!
Ok, but can he say 'Sonar'?  Sounds like you've got a fishing protoge in the making Simon!
Smart little guy Jack sure is growing up fast  Soon he'll say to you "Can you say.... Let's Go Fishing Dad"
Wait til he learns to say, "skip school, go fishing, Dad".  Best phrase I ever taught the kids. He's cute, and he's sharp. Love it.

Most new mothers would not let me teach my grandkids like that...  I think the best was young J.C. who went to nursery schools and repeated:  Tea, tea...makes you pee,  Down your leg and over your knee...  The teacher said "Who taught you that ?"  "My Dad'' ... Poor Chris got blamed. not me...  JC's brother Daniel thought it was great that he was allowed to say "We went fishing at the dam at Hastings"
can you say "Team 2", i have another entry?  hey simon, good thing when you asked--can you say flasher? he didnt say daddy.  keep up the reports simon, i love this one
